content.question:
Figure 1 represents a portion of a process that occurs during protein synthesis.

Figure 1. Model of selected features of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> transcription

Which claim is most consistent with the information provided by the diagram and current scientific understanding of gene regulation and expression?

choices.label: Reversible changes in the <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sequence may influence how a gene is expressed in a cell.
Some sequences of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can interact with regulatory proteins that control transcription.
This is an inducible operon controlled by several regulatory factors.
The transcription factor may produce mutations in the binding site at the promoter sequence inhibiting the synthesis of the protein.

content.answer: Some sequences of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can interact with regulatory proteins that control transcription.
